title: Police officer illegally rides hoverboard scooter on London street
text:
Crime Police officer illegally rides hoverboard scooter on London street A policewoman has been caught on camera illegally riding a hoverboard scooter in public despite it being against the law By Telegraph Video , video source SWNS 2:36PM BST 19 Oct 2015 
A police officer has been filmed illegally riding a hoverboard scooter down a London street just days after it was confirmed to be against the law . 
In a video posted to YouTube the policewoman can be seen riding the so-called 'swegway' after being coaxed into doing so by a man on the street. 
The footage was posted online just a week after the Metropolitan Police tweeted to confirm guidance from the Crown Prosecution Service that the "self-balancing scooters" cannot be ridden on roads or pavements, and are only allowed on private property. 
The policewoman can be seen on the video riding a 'swegway' down a London street 
They tweeted a picture of a 'swegway' with the message: "Own one of these or thinking about getting one? They’re illegal to ride in public!” Own one of these or thinking about getting one? They're illegal to ride in public! Info here: http://t.co/We85yLAzsU pic.twitter.com/vMm0hxNAjs — MPS Specials (@MPSSpecials) October 11, 2015 
The vehicles, which have become a common sight on streets and range from around £200 to several hundred pounds, are a sort-of sideways electric skateboard, with users leaning forward or backward to control them. 
This video, which was created by Shah Faisal Shinwari, was made to highlight how the police are not necessarily always aware of the latest laws. 
YouTube user Shah Faisal Shinwari created the video to show how the police are not necessarily always aware of the latest laws 
He said: "We decided to test out what Police would do if we rode a swegway around London."
